descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Students will expand their knowledge of a particular national security issue through seminars, lectures and field trips, then launch an intensive multimedia reporting project on the subject. The reporting likely will include some travel. Students work closely with the instructors as well as professional media partners. It is capped at 10 students, who are awarded $7,500 scholarships to participate as part of Medill's new National Security Journalism Initiative. Prerequisites are either the U.S. Security and Civil Liberties Reporting class taught in Chicago, or Covering Conflicts, Terrorism and National Security, taught in Washington.
